item.name: DisplayName
item.locDescr: Name of service.

item.name: HostName
item.locDescr: Host on which service resides.

item.name: SQLServiceType
item.locDescr: Service type.

item.name: State
item.locDescr: The current state of this service.

item.name: StartMode
item.locDescr: The start mode of this service.

item.name: LogOnUsingLocalAccount
item.locDescr: True if service is using LocalSystem account to log on.

item.name: StartName
item.locDescr: Account name under which service runs.

item.name: OldPassword
item.locDescr: Old password used for the account under which service runs.

item.name: PasswordForLogin
item.locDescr: Password for the account under which service runs.

item.name: VerifyPassword
item.locDescr: Verify (retype) the new password.

item.name: ErrorControl
item.locDescr: If this service fails to start, this property specifies the severity of the error.

item.name: BinaryPath
item.locDescr: Path to the executable file for this service.

item.name: ProcessID
item.locDescr: Process ID used by operating system to identify the service process.

item.name: ExitCode
item.locDescr: The Win32 error code defining problems in starting or stopping the service.

item.name: VERSION
item.locDescr: Version of SQL Server instance

item.name: SPLEVEL
item.locDescr: Service Pack level applied on this SQL Server instance.

item.name: CLUSTERED
item.locDescr: Indicates whether SQL Server is part of a cluster or not.

item.name: INSTALLPATH
item.locDescr: Path where SQL Server was installed

item.name: DATAPATH
item.locDescr: Path to default data folder

item.name: FILEVERSION
item.locDescr: Version number of the SQL Server executable file.

item.name: VSNAME
item.locDescr: Virtual server name (if Clustered = yes).

item.name: REGROOT
item.locDescr: Registry root for selected SQL Server instance

item.name: SKU
item.locDescr: Stock Keeping Unit number of the installed edition

item.name: INSTANCEID
item.locDescr: ID of SQL Server instance

item.name: STARTUPPARAMETERS
item.locDescr: Parameters used by SQL Server at service startup

item.name: SQLSTATES
item.locDescr: SQL states

item.name: ERRORREPORTING
item.locDescr: Enable Error Reporting

item.name: DUMPDIR
item.locDescr: Folder used for dumping error information

item.name: SQMREPORTING
item.locDescr: Enable Customer Feedback reporting.

item.name: SKUNAME
item.locDescr: Stock Keeping Unit name of the installed edition

item.name: ISWOW64
item.locDescr: Indicates whether this 32-bit service is running on a 64-bit operating system.

item.name: BROWSER
item.locDescr: Indicates whether the SQL Browser service is listening.

item.name: ForceEncryption
item.locDescr: Turn on or off encryption for selected server instance

item.name: HideInstance
item.locDescr: Prevents the SQL Server Browser service from exposing this instance of the Database Engine to client computers

item.locDescr: Friendly name for certificate

item.locDescr: IP address

item.locDescr: Indicates whether the selected IP Address is active.

item.name: ANSItoOEM
item.locDescr: ANSI to OEM property can be used to specify if ANSI to OEM conversion is allowed

item.name: Date
item.locDescr: Creation date for DBLib available on client machine

item.name: FileName
item.locDescr: Name of DBLib file

item.name: UseInternationalSettings
item.locDescr: Turn on/off international settings

item.name: Size
item.locDescr: DBLib libary size

item.name: Force protocol encryption
item.locDescr: Request a Secure Sockets Layer connection

item.name: Trust Server Certificate
item.locDescr: Skip server certificate validation

item.name: Force protocol encryption
item.locDescr: Force Protocol Encryption

item.name: Trust Server Certificate
item.locDescr: Trust Server Certificate

item.name: sm
item.locDescr: Protocol used by client to communicate with local server via Shared Memory. If enabled this protocol is always first.

item.name: tcp
item.locDescr: Protocol used by client to comunicate with a server via TCP/IP. TCP/IP Sockets is a non-authenticated protocol.

item.name: np
item.locDescr: Protocol used by client to communicate with a server via Named Pipes. Named Pipes is an authenticated protocol.

item.name: via
item.locDescr: Protocol used by client to communicate with a server via Virtual Interface Architecture.

item.name: Default Port
item.locDescr: Default port on which connection will be made

item.name: KEEPALIVE (in milliseconds)
item.locDescr: How often TCP verifies that an idle connection is still intact

item.name: KEEPALIVEINTERVAL (in milliseconds)
item.locDescr: The retry interval for unresponsive TCP KEEPALIVE transmissions

item.name: Enabled
item.locDescr: Enable or disable TCP/IP protocol for this client

item.locDescr: Default Port

item.name: KEEPALIVE (in milliseconds)
item.locDescr: Keep Alive

item.name: KEEPALIVEINTERVAL (in milliseconds)
item.locDescr: Keep Alive Interval

item.name: Default Pipe
item.locDescr: Default pipe used for communication

item.locDescr: Enable or disable Named Pipe protocol for this client

item.locDescr: Name of library containing implementation for VIA protocol

item.locDescr: Enable or disable Shared Memory protocol for this client

item.name: Name
item.locDescr: Shared Memory

item.name: AliasName
item.locDescr: Name of the new alias that will be created

item.name: ServerName
item.locDescr: Name of server to which the alias will point

item.name: ProtocolName
item.locDescr: Name of the protocol that will be used for this alias

item.name: ConnectionString
item.locDescr: Connection string associated with the new alias

item.name: Encrypted
item.locDescr: Tells us if connection made via this new alias will use encryption

item.name: Shared Memory
item.locDescr: Shared Memory protocol does not require any connection parameters

item.name: Named Pipes
item.locDescr: Name of pipe should match pipe name used by SQL Server instance

item.name: TCP/IP
item.locDescr: Port number used by the new alias to connect to SQL Server

item.name: VIA
item.locDescr: VIA settings used by the new alias to connect to SQL Server

item.name: Unknown
item.locDescr: Connection info used by the new alias for the specified protocol

item.name: AliasName
item.locDescr: Name of the existing alias

item.name: ServerName
item.locDescr: Name of server to which the alias points

item.name: ProtocolName
item.locDescr: Name of the protocol used by the alias

item.name: ConnectionString
item.locDescr: Connection string associated with the alias

item.name: Encrypted
item.locDescr: Tells us if connection made via this alias uses encryption

item.name: Shared Memory
item.locDescr: Shared Memory protocol does not require any connection parameters

item.name: Named Pipes
item.locDescr: Name of pipe used by the alias to connect to SQL Server

item.name: TCP/IP
item.locDescr: Port number used by the alias to connect to SQL Server

item.name: VIA
item.locDescr: VIA settings used by the alias to connect to SQL Server

item.name: Unknown
item.locDescr: Connection info used by the alias for the specified protocol

item.name: InstanceName
item.locDescr: Name of instance

item.name: VirtualRoot
item.locDescr: Virtual root used for reports

item.name: PathName
item.locDescr: Local path to application files

item.name: URLToReportServer
item.locDescr: URL pointing to the Report Server

item.name: URLToReportServerWebService
item.locDescr: URL pointing to the Report Server Web Service

item.name: InstanceName
item.locDescr: Instance name

item.name: PathName
item.locDescr: Path to executable

item.name: VirtualRoot
item.locDescr: Compleate URL describing virtual root

item.name: InstanceID
item.locDescr: Unique identifier for a specific report service

item.name: DatabaseServerName
item.locDescr: Machine name Report Server Database is running on

item.name: DatabaseName
item.locDescr: Instance name of Report Server Database

item.name: Impersonate
item.locDescr: Impersonate Windows user when connecting to Report Server Database

item.name: ImpersonateDomain
item.locDescr: Domain for the user used to impersonate when connectiong to Report Server Database

item.name: ImpersonateUserName
item.locDescr: User used to impersonate when connectiong to Report Server Database

item.name: ImpersonatePassword
item.locDescr: Password for the user used to impersonate when connectiong to Report Server Database

item.name: DatabaseIntegratedSecurity
item.locDescr: Database integrated security

item.name: DatabaseLogonName
item.locDescr: User name to use when service logs into the Report Server Database

item.name: DatabaseLogonPassword
item.locDescr: Password fot the Database Logon account

item.name: DatabaseLoginTimeout
item.locDescr: The number of seconds to wait before returning from a failed Report Server Database login attempt. A value of 0 allows for an infinite wait.

item.name: DatabaseQueryTimeout
item.locDescr: The number of seconds that must elapse before the Report Server assumes the command failed or took too much time to perform (times out).

item.name: UnattendedExecutionLogonDomain
item.locDescr: Domain of the user the report server uses to impersonate when running reports unattended.

item.name: UnattendedExecutionLogonName
item.locDescr: The user name the report server uses to impersonate when running reports unattended.

item.name: UnattendedExecutionLogonPassword
item.locDescr: The password to use in conjunction with the logon name the report server uses to impersonate when running reports unattended.
